text: Stockholm Lisboa Project is a Portuguese/Swedish folk music band. == History == Founded in 2006 they are based in Sweden and Portugal, and have received the German Record Critics' Award (2009"Preis der deutschen Schallplattenkritik: Bestenliste 3/2009", Germany, 15 may 2009 and 2013"Preis der deutschen Schallplattenkritik: Bestenliste 1/2013", Germany, 16 february 2013), was selected for a showcase at Womex in Copenhagen. The band was nominated to the Songlines Music AwardsSonglines (magazine), London, April/May 2010 #67 issue 2010 and also the Swedish Folk & World Music Awards 2012. The group has played live radio concerts for RDP in Portugal (2007, 2008, 2009), SR in Sweden (2007), WDR in Germany (2009), NDR in Germany (2016), YLE in Finland (2008), Spanish National Radio (2011) as well as concerts in festivals and concert halls around the world. == Line-up == === Current members === *Simon Stålspets - nordic mandola, goat horn, willow flute, harmonica, vocals *Sérgio Crisóstomo - violin, vocals *Rita Maria - lead vocals *Alice Andersson - saxophone, vocals === Past members === *Liana - vocalist (member from 2006~2011, participated on the records "Sol" (2007) & "Diagonal" (2009)) *Luis Peixoto - mandolin (member from 2006~2007, participated on the record "Sol" (2007)) *Micaela Vaz - vocalist *Filip Jers - harmonica == Discography == *2007: Sol *2009: DiagonalWestpark Music, WP 87177 *2012: AuroraWestpark Music, WP 87235 *2016: Janela == References == == External links == *Official home page *Simon Stålspets (Official website) *Sérgio Crisóstomo (Official website) Category:Swedish folk music groups Category:Swedish folk music Category:Portuguese folk music
title: Stockholm Lisboa Project
